senses.lear_examp: I could have written a letter in a bottle but waiting for the answer would take a decade, now with e-mail it's just a click of a button.

senses.sense: a small, round object used to fasten something, for example a shirt or coat
senses.dict_examp: I need to sew a new button on my blouse.
senses.lear_examp: It was a long dress with some square buttons on the front of it.

senses.sense: a woman who works in business, especially if she has a high position in a company
senses.dict_examp: She is a successful businesswoman.

senses.sense: to get something by paying money for it
senses.dict_examp: Eventually she had saved enough money to buy a small car.
senses.lear_examp: I bought it five years ago.

senses.sense: used to introduce an added statement, usually something that is different from what you have said before
senses.dict_examp: You can invite Keith to the party, but please don't ask that friend of his.
senses.lear_examp: There are eight rooms but the best one is my bedroom, because there are a lot of books.

senses.sense: used before you say why something will not or did not happen or is not true
senses.dict_examp: I was going to go to his party, but I was ill.
senses.lear_examp: I'm really sorry I haven't written for so long, but I was very busy last week.

senses.sense: except
senses.dict_examp: Everyone knows but Andrew.
senses.lear_examp: I'm free all days of the week but Monday and Wednesday.

senses.sense: almost
senses.dict_examp: The movie was all but over by the time we got there.
senses.lear_examp: He could all but hear their stomachs rumble.

senses.sense: an insect with large, patterned wings
senses.dict_examp: A butterfly landed on her sleeve for a moment.
senses.lear_examp: There were lots of wild flowers and we saw some beautiful birds and butterflies.

senses.sense: a feeling of excitement, energy, or pleasure
senses.dict_examp: He gets a real buzz from going to the gym.
senses.lear_examp: The reading groups will then create a real buzz in the community in regard to reading.

senses.sense: a continuous sound like a bee makes
senses.dict_examp: I could hear the buzz of a fly near my ear.
senses.lear_examp: I was working when I started hearing a kind of buzz, that was getting louder and louder.

senses.sense: to make a continuous noise like a bee
senses.dict_examp: I can hear something buzzing.
senses.lear_examp: They are now sitting quietly at their desks in a classroom where you can hear the flies buzz.

senses.sense: to be full of activity and excitement
senses.dict_examp: The crowd was buzzing with excitement.
senses.lear_examp: Summer was getting into full swing and the city was buzzing with activity.

senses.sense: the part of your body that you sit on
senses.dict_examp: The baby is learning to walk and keeps falling on her butt.

senses.sense: to interrupt or join in a conversation or activity when the other people do not want you to
senses.dict_examp: The interviewer kept butting in and wouldn't let me answer the question.
senses.lear_examp: "Was it a big one, Granny?", the little girl butted in.

senses.sense: someone who buys something expensive such as a house
senses.dict_examp: He's still looking for a buyer for his house.
senses.lear_examp: She had already found a buyer for the famous painting.

senses.sense: to put a dead body into the ground
senses.dict_examp: His father was buried in the churchyard.
senses.lear_examp: Apparently, no human being was walking outside and she could not even hear anything but a distant bell, certainly that of the church where they had buried poor aunt Charlotte.

senses.sense: to put something into a hole in the ground and cover it
senses.dict_examp: The dog trotted off to bury its bone.
senses.lear_examp: I was really frightened, so I decided to bury the money in the back garden.

senses.sense: to give all your attention to something
senses.dict_examp: He buried himself in his work.
senses.lear_examp: Miss Kenton is clearly attracted to the butler but he is equally clearly terrified of intimacy and buries himself in his work.

senses.sense: to move your face/head somewhere where it is hidden
senses.dict_examp: She buried her face in her hands.
senses.lear_examp: A seemingly courageous young man, who had stayed perfectly calm until that moment, dropped to his knees, then buried his face in the scorching sand.

senses.sense: a person who sells meat in a store
senses.lear_examp: He  started to work as a butcher.

senses.sense: a large vehicle in which people are driven from one place to another
senses.dict_examp: You should take the bus if you want to see the sights.
senses.lear_examp: You can get there by bus.

senses.sense: a short, thick plant with a lot of branches
senses.dict_examp: a rose bush
senses.lear_examp: There were so many flowers and bushes, and the water of the lake was so  fresh.

senses.sense: to avoid talking about something difficult or embarrassing
senses.dict_examp: I decided to stop beating around the bush and told him exactly what I thought of him.
senses.lear_examp: Well, let's stop beating about the bush and get to the point.

senses.sense: areas in places like Africa and Australia that are covered with bushes and trees where very few people live
senses.dict_examp: He spent weeks wandering in the bush.
senses.lear_examp: For the first three days we were walking through different types of bush that changed like in a kaleidoscope; the swampy, the dry, the barren.

senses.sense: If you are busy, you are working hard, or giving your attention to a particular thing
senses.dict_examp: Mom was busy in the kitchen.
senses.lear_examp: I'm sorry I haven't written before, but I've been very busy studying.

senses.sense: A busy place is full of activity or people.
senses.dict_examp: a busy restaurant
senses.lear_examp: Despite the fact that Rome is a busy city, you can find quiet places like Broccian lake and the seaside in Ostia.

senses.sense: In a busy period, you have a lot of things to do.
senses.dict_examp: I've got a busy week ahead of me.
senses.lear_examp: It was a busy day.

senses.sense: the place where a bus starts or ends its journey
senses.dict_examp: The bus station is downtown.
senses.lear_examp: I will meet you at the bus station.

senses.sense: used to show the person or thing that does something
senses.dict_examp: She  was examined by a doctor.
senses.lear_examp: You have to read the "House of Terror" by Constanza Vanges, which is about strange things that start happening in a house.

senses.sense: used to show how something is done
senses.dict_examp: They traveled across Europe by train/car.
senses.lear_examp: You can go there by bus.

senses.sense: not later than; at/on or before
senses.dict_examp: She promised to be back by five o'clock.
senses.lear_examp: Please come tomorrow by 3 o'clock in the afternoon to paint my bedroom.

senses.sense: used when you say something new or on a different subject
senses.dict_examp: I think we've discussed everything we need to - by the way, what time is it?
senses.lear_examp: By the way, I want to buy a raincoat for my brother.

senses.sense: near or next to something or someone
senses.dict_examp: A small child stood by her side.
senses.lear_examp: I think the best solution could be to put a desk by the window because I'll have natural light and a double bed next to the door.

senses.sense: as a result of an accident, mistake, etc.
senses.dict_examp: I went to the wrong room by mistake.
senses.lear_examp: I was putting my shopping bags on the table and I pushed it by mistake.

senses.sense: done or made by a person instead of a machine
senses.dict_examp: This sweater has to be washed by hand.

senses.sense: holding a particular part of someone or something
senses.dict_examp: She grabbed me by the arm.

senses.sense: by a great amount

senses.sense: so that you can remember all of something
senses.dict_examp: We had to learn the whole poem by heart.

senses.sense: used in particular phrases to mean "gradually" or "in units of"

senses.sense: used to show measurements or amounts

senses.lear_examp: Therefore you will see that this festival attracts people by the truckload.

senses.sense: as said by a lot of people

senses.sense: in general
senses.dict_examp: By and large, people have welcomed the changes.

senses.sense: If you have to do something by law, it is illegal not to do it.
senses.dict_examp: They have to provide a contract by law.
senses.lear_examp: They consist in preparing e-mails or letters, all formal, giving explanations to clients about their fiscal situation in Brazil, preparing and calculating tax returns, providing to the IRS our clients asset positions, which is required by law and also, having meetings with clients - this is the most important and exciting part of our work.

senses.sense: not in any way
senses.dict_examp: I'm not an expert by any means.

senses.sense: as a type of something
